name: Lightspout Waterfall Walk, Carding Mill Valley

ai.summary: Lightspout Waterfall Walk is a 12.9 km moderate hike in Carding Mill Valley, UK, offering close views of Lightspout Waterfall and surrounding woodland and hills. The route combines forest tracks with gentle ascents and exposed viewpoints, making it suitable for hikers with some experience who enjoy waterfalls.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain including forest tracks, gentle ascents, and some uneven, rocky sections. Expect a few stairs and boardwalks, with potentially muddy ground after rain. Surfaces near the waterfall can be slick, so sturdy boots and careful footing are recommended. The route provides open viewpoints over the surrounding hills.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for changeable UK weather: wear waterproof clothing and bring a layer. Wear sturdy footwear and stay on marked paths; watch for slippery rocks near the waterfall and muddy slopes. The hike is moderate but long, so carry enough water and snacks, and consider daylight availability. Supervise children and pets, and carry a map/phone with battery kept topped up.
recommended_gear: Daypack with water, snacks, and a map or offline navigation
Lightweight waterproof shell and extra layers
Headlamp or flashlight (if hiking near dusk)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal for comfortable conditions and good waterfall views; water flow is often highest after rainfall. Winter visits can be very muddy and slippery, requiring extra caution.
